children.value: To get or modify the attributes of an AST node, the input parameters can be divided into three cases:
Return the node or attribute value corresponding to the attribute name
attribute name of the ast node, supports multi-layer attributes, connected by
Modify the node or attribute value corresponding to the attribute name
attribute name of ast node, supports multi-layer attributes, connected by .
Modify the node or attribute obtained by the first input parameter to this input parameter
Note: The string will not be parsed as an ast node but directly replace the original attribute
Modify the nodes or attribute values ​​corresponding to multiple attribute names

Determine whether there is a child node, the return value is boolean type
Input parameters are the same as
Returns a new node deep copied from the current node
inside the current node, and return the current node
Code selector, which can be code or can replace part of the code with wildcards
Replace the code, the same as the wildcard sequence of the code selector and the selector
It can also be a definite ast node
whether to ignore sequence when matching
Replace the current node with replacerAST, returning the new node
Insert a node of the same level after the current node and return the current node
Insert a node of the same level before the current node and return the current node
Insert a child node at the end of an array property inside the current node and return the current node
Array attribute name of the current node
Why do you need to pass in

Because multiple attributes in some nodes are arrays, such as functions, there are two array sub-nodes of input parameter params and function body body, and attr must be used to determine the position of the inserted node
Insert a child node at the first position of an array property inside the current node and return the current node
Clear all child nodes of the current node and return to the current node
Remove the current node and return to the root node
